Function Documentation

PIZBoundedQueue* pizBoundedQueueNew ( long  size  ) 

Create the queue.

In case of failure the pointer is NULL.

Parameters:
size The maximum number of values in the queue.
Returns:
A pointer to the new queue.

void pizBoundedQueueFree ( PIZBoundedQueue *  x  ) 

Free the queue.

It is safe to pass NULL pointer.

Parameters:
x A Pointer.

void pizBoundedQueueClear ( PIZBoundedQueue *  x  ) 

Clear the queue.

Parameters:
x A valid pointer.

PIZError pizBoundedQueueAppend ( PIZBoundedQueue *  x,
long  value 
)

Enqueue a value.

Return PIZ_ERROR if the number of values is over the size of the queue.

Parameters:
x A valid pointer.
value The value to append.
Returns:
An error code.

PIZError pizBoundedQueuePop ( PIZBoundedQueue *  x  ) 

Dequeue a value.

To get the dequeued value use pizBoundedQueuePoppedValue(). Return PIZ_ERROR if the queue is empty.

Parameters:
x A valid pointer.
Returns:
An error code.

PIZError pizBoundedQueuePopLastValue ( PIZBoundedQueue *  x  ) 

Dequeue last value (stack way).

To get the dequeued value use pizBoundedQueuePoppedValue(). Return PIZ_ERROR if the queue is empty.

Parameters:
x A valid pointer.
Returns:
An error code.

long pizBoundedQueueCount ( const PIZBoundedQueue *  x  ) 

Get the number of values in the queue.

Parameters:
x A valid pointer.
Returns:
The number of values.

long pizBoundedQueuePoppedValue ( const PIZBoundedQueue *  x  ) 

Get the dequeued value.

This value is initialized with -1.

Parameters:
x A valid pointer.
Returns:
The value.
